Class Bullet

java.lang.Object
  SimObject
      Bullet

public class Bullet
extends SimObject

This class will create the bullet that the Defender will shoot in the Millipede game

Method Detail

updateState

public boolean updateState(Landscape scape)
Updates the state of the bullet on the Landscape. It will check to see if the bullet hits any simObjects, if it does it will damage that simObject otherwise it will move one unit up toward the top.

Specified by:
updateState in class SimObject
Parameters:
scape - the Landscape being played on
Returns:
true if the object survives updating its state, false if it does not

checkPath

public SimObject checkPath(Landscape scape)
This method will check the path of the bullet and see if it hits any SimObjects in the way. If it does it will Return the simObject that it hit.

It can hit two different types of SimObjects, the millipede or an obstacle on the landscape

Returns:
SimObject the bullet hit

checkForHit

private SimObject checkForHit(SimObject closestHit,
                              SimObject test)
This method will check the test SimObject to see if it is going to be hit by the bullet and if it is closer than the closestHit SimObject, it will return whichever is closer.

Parameters:
closestHit - - SimObject that is currently the closest to the start of the bullet's path
test - - SimObject to test and see if it will be hit by the bullet and is closer than ClosesstHit
Returns:
simObject that is closer between the two of them

move

public boolean move()
This method will move the bullet in the vertical direction up the landscape by a given B_SPEED amount

Returns:
returns false if it goes off the board, true otherwise

draw

public void draw(Graphics g,
                 int x,
                 int y,
                 int scale)
Description copied from class: SimObject
Draws this object on a Graphics object. The point (x, y) specifies the position of the object in screen coordinates. The scale specifies the size of a single unit of land.

Specified by:
draw in class SimObject
Parameters:
g - the Graphics object to draw to
x - the x position in screen coordinates
y - the y position in screen coordinates
scale - the size in pixels of a single unit of land
